item.description:
(This venue is very accessible via MBTA: just a few steps from the Outbound station - Essex Street entrance - at the Central Square stop on the Red Line, and across the street or around the block from Central Square bus stops. Attendees can PARK FREE AFTER 6 PM on-street and in the lots beside the Cafe off Bishop Richard Allen Drive and Norfolk Street- **DO NOT USE THE LOT THAT IS ACCESSIBLE FROM ESSEX STREET, as your car WILL be towed!!**)

Refreshments at Clear Conscience Cafe range from $1.85 for a drink to ~$8 for a sandwich plate.   There is no specified purchase minimum for refreshments, but participants are encouraged to order something to support the business, in appreciation of Management's permission to meet in their space.   Please be advised: Commercial eating establishments generally do not permit on-site consumption of refreshments brought in from elsewhere, due to liability concerns, so please be considerate. 

 

______________________________________________

 

excavate [ˈɛkskəˌveɪt] vb - (Social Science / Archaeology) to unearth (buried objects) methodically in an attempt to discover information about the past -The Free Online Dictionary.

Bring your calendar or datebook (wherever you maintain your schedule) AND, if possible, a photo - digital or print - of the space you'd MOST like to clear SOONEST. Start reflecting on the dream(s) that space potentially holds for you- and the story behind all the stuff occupying the space right now, instead: what it seems to say about your journey up to this point. Then come SHARE your vision and the challenges obscuring it right now- and let's put Your Dream on a production schedule with You in control- not stuff.

This is rather short notice, but because our last meeting venue was so noisy and distracting, I've embarked on a Quest for More Suitable Venues- and welcome your input, which I realize might be staggered throughout the evening for such an informal event ... just come for any time period between 7 and 9 pm that is most convenient for you (specifying in your RSVP Comment the particular time period you plan to participate) to join a "miniClinic"- for help to move us all in directions we want to go. Please just be advised that, if nobody RSVPs to come late in the evening, I might leave before 9 pm if no other group members are on hand UNLESS:

(1) I am notified of a definite late arrival by a group member on Meetup.com by 5 pm the day of the event AND

(2) I RESPOND by stating that I will wait until a set time for the late RSVPer to arrive.

We can discuss neurolinguistic programming (and practice some EFT & NLP techniques) for making changes faster than we'd thought possible; find inspiration; share support, resources online and off-line, tips & tricks, and consider various possible sorts of welcomed accountability; brainstorm programs and events (including how best to introduce our group to YOUR possible clutter-related services or products?), and sustainability of such a service and group as this could be- while enjoying the cuisine and ambiance of a restaurant(s) that particularly appeals to you and thus attracts people somewhat like you (some of whom might share and support your vision? Who knows??).

Since learning, recall, and success are "state-specific," from what I keep reading, let's meet in a nurturing, nourishing environment that you especially enjoy, to put you in a state of consciousness as peaceful and reflective as possible, discussing Dreams and how to achieve them for "Level-10 Living" your way- partly by clearing precious space and time in your life:  the mission of our larger group. Specifically, let's figure out how to get you on track and keep you there until you achieve your Dream that is currently buried within a cluttered space.

How better to Go for it than by having FUN along the way? I would love to check out one or a few venues each week, in a range of prices (including free, which likely will preclude refreshments and amenities ... or not? Input is welcomed!) so our group members can have a range of choices, reflecting our diversity. Do suggest favorite spots of your own- I am especially looking for:

• QUIET restaurants with various seating capacities, cuisines, and ambiances- especially those that might flexibly accommodate our group (e.g., by turning background music down or even off, if requested, to improve a meeting program) in SAFE sections of the metro-Boston area (venues en route to Methuen would facilitate Kevin Martin's organizing more NLP Meetups jointly with us!)

• Accessible to public transportation on relatively high-frequency travel schedule(s), including return trips later than 9:15 pm

• Free, safe (e.g., well lit) parking close by

• Private or semi-private room(s) or space(s)

 

Come join us!  (Or specify a better time and place for you to do so).  In fact- please take this opportunity to Share Your Abundance:  If you have any of the following items in good condition that you'd like to release, please bring to this Meetup for me to donate to my church's Gifts of the Heart project (Disaster Assistance in conjunction with the Church World Service):

  • Face towels
  • Hand towels
  • Nail clippers
  • Individual-sized soaps (3-4-oz size)

My church collects these items to pack hygiene kits for emergency response to disasters such as the recent earthquake and tsunami in Japan, and the earthquake in Haiti ... finished kits are then sent to a central clearing house in readiness for shipment to disaster sites at a moment's notice.

Please give the above-listed items to me directly - DO NOT ask Clear Conscience Cafe staff to take any items before or after our Meetup, to give to me.

Thank You!
item.how_to_find_us: I'll have a red & white Meetup sign at my table
item.why: Informal opportunity to meet in a small group or one-on-one to "reframe"- learn or practice neurolinguistic programming (NLP) methods, achieve a "Gestalt switch," increase accountability to facilitate decluttering...whatever YOU need to progress!

group.name: Tools for Decluttering, Personal Change & Goal Attainment

item.name: "Freeing SpaceTime" miniCLINIC: Excavating Dreams
